titleStmt.title: Handling Missing Data with Variational Bayesian Learning of ICA

address.addrLine: 10010 N. Torrey Pines Road, La Jolla
10010 N. Torrey Pines Road, La Jolla
10010 N. Torrey Pines Road, La Jolla

analytic.title: Handling Missing Data with Variational Bayesian Learning of ICA

abstract.p: Missing data is common in real-world datasets and is a problem for many estimation techniques. We have developed a variational Bayesian method to perform Independent Component Analysis (ICA) on high-dimensional data containing missing entries. Missing data are handled naturally in the Bayesian framework by integrating the generative density model. Mod-eling the distributions of the independent sources with mixture of Gaus-sians allows sources to be estimated with different kurtosis and skewness. The variational Bayesian method automatically determines the dimen-sionality of the data and yields an accurate density model for the observed data without overfitting problems. This allows direct probability estimation of missing values in the high dimensional space and avoids dimension reduction preprocessing which is not feasible with missing data.
